body:
Hi Mostapha, Yes, I think it is a good idea. I attached a file where you can see the function. It is not perfect yet, but I think its method is very interesting. I think Rhino 5 has some issues with boolean union functions, because sometimes it doesn't work with some lists of curves or surfaces, but if you try to change the order of elements and then repeating the function, it works. And this is basically what my function does. However, sometimes it is very slow or it could go to an infinite loop when the solution is almost impossible. For this reason I wrote a limit condition inside the loop. If you want and you are interested in it, you could work on this method. Best
Antonello
